Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class LSQR.SolveAProd

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.LSQR.SolveAProd
All Implemented Interfaces:
Callable<LSQR.PartialResult>
Enclosing class:
LSQR
public class LSQR.SolveAProd extends Object implements Callable<LSQR.PartialResult>
Parallel task that solves aProd in the forward or backward direction for the row based solution "u" or the column based solution "v". The solution looks like for (i = row_start; i < row_stop; ++i) { int strt = aRowPtr[i]; int stop = aRowPtr[i+1]; double r = aU[i]; for (int j = strt; j < stop; ++j) r += aSprsRow[j] * aV[aColIndx[j]]; aU[i] = r; } When updating aU, and for (i = col_start; i < col_stop; ++i) { int strt = aColPtr[i]; int stop = aColPtr[i+1]; double r = aV[i]; for (int j = strt; j < stop; ++j) r += aSprsCol[j] * aU[aRowIndx[j]]; aV[i] = r; } When updating aV. Note that each task only solves a subset of the rows (row_start to row_stop when solving for aU) or columns (col_start to col_stop when solving for aV) in a single tasks. The sum of all tasks solves for all rows or columns. Each task is processed as a thread to gain parallel performance. Unfortunately, the task are heavily weighted toward memory access per flop (3) which makes them band-width limited on multicore computers.

The array of tasks for "u" and "v" are contained in uTasks and vTasks and are constructed in the function buildParallelTasks().

  • Constructor Details

    • SolveAProd

      public SolveAProd​(int strt, int stop, double[] y, double[] x, int[] ptr, double[] sprs, int[] xIndx)
      Standard constructor for the parallel aProd task. Sets the input arguments in preparation for solving for aU or aV.
      Parameters:
      strt - First row (in aRowPtr if this is a uTask) or column (in aColPtr if this is a vTask) to process by this task.
      stop - Last - 1 row (in aRowPtr if this is a uTask) or column (in aColPtr if this is a vTask) to process by this task.
      y - The vector to be updated (aU for uTasks or aV for vTasks).
      x - The vector multiplying the sparse matrix to update y (aV for uTasks or aU for vTasks).
      ptr - The row or column pointer vector (aRowPtr for uTasks or aColPtr for vTasks).
      sprs - The row oriented or column oriented sparse matrix (aRowSprs for uTasks or aColSprs for vTasks).
      xIndx - The column index or row index vector to indirectly address into x (aColIndx for uTasks or aRowIndx for vTasks).

  • Method Details

    • setScale

      public void setScale​(double scl)
      Puts the task into scale mode. When the concurrent submission calls the function call() it will calle scale() to scale the aY vector by the input scale value (scl).
      Parameters:
      scl - The factor by aY will be scaled.

    • set2Norm

      public void set2Norm()
      Puts the task into 2 norm mode. When the concurrent submission calls the function call() it will calculate the sum of squares of aY and store the result into aPR.rslt for later retrieval.

    • call

      public LSQR.PartialResult call()
      Concurrent entry. Call scale() if aScaleFlg is set. Otherwise call update.
      Specified by:
      call in interface Callable<LSQR.PartialResult>
